data.title: American Film Institute
data.meta_description:
The debut – and only – feature as director, writer and producer from star Barbara Loden, WANDA (1971) was chosen as the only American entry in the 1970 Venice Film Festival, where it won the International Critics' Prize for Best Film. The film received almost universally laudatory reviews – including one from the Los Angeles Times noting that she and costar Michael Higgins “deserve to be remembered in the next year’s Oscar® race.”

Visit the AFI Catalog to learn more about WANDA.
Have Get The Picture delivered to your inbox every day.
data.text:
This website uses cookies so that we can provide you with the best user experience possible. Cookie information is stored in your browser and performs functions such as recognising you when you return to our website and helping our team to understand which sections of the website you find most interesting and useful.

You can adjust all of your cookie settings by navigating the tabs on the left hand side.
